properties.areaDesc: Gove; Wichita; Cheyenne; Yuma County; Rawlins; Kit Carson County; Thomas; Sheridan; Wallace; Logan; Dundy; Sherman
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 28 at 1:16AM MST until January 28 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Goodland KS
properties.description:
* WHAT...2 to 4 inches of wet snow.

* WHERE...Portions of northeast Colorado, northwest Kansas, and
extreme southwest Nebraska.

* WHEN...Until 8 AM MST /9 AM CST/ Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions associated with several
inches of wet snow.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The National Weather Service in Goodland
measured 3.5 inches of snow at midnight MST. Snow will taper off
from northwest to southeast by sunrise, earliest in northeast
Colorado and adjacent Kansas border counties where the bulk of
accumulating snow has already fallen. Through 4 am MST, moderate
to heavy snow will be most likely along and east of a line from
Leoti to Gove City to Hill City.
properties.instruction:
Dangerous travel conditions are present across the advisory area.
Consider alternate travel plans. If you must travel, slow down,
turn off cruise control, and exercise additional caution,
particularly at intersections and highway onramps and offramps
where accidents are more likely to occur.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST /9 AM CST/ THIS MORNING
